alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 2:23AM PST until January 04 at 9:29PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Polk and Benton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...From this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely, especially if the Willamette is running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:51 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 27.1 feet later this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later this afternoon or this evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM PST.
